channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024031342
item.description:
Report X-2024031342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon opening the trailer for unloading at 8:18am the Unload Manager noticed the Hazmat package laying on it's side and areas of the package wet. The Unload Manager informed QA Personnel who secured the package and brought it to the Hazmat processing cage. DescribePack: Due to the Hazmat package being loaded improperly into the trailer it caused pressure on the bottles causing the caps to loosen and leak through the packaging. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: QA personnel secured the Hazmat package into a Hazmat drum upright to stop leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024031045
item.description:
Report X-2024031045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO SIX PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING ASSORTED BAGS OF FRIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. ALL PACKAGES ARE ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER BOXES PREPRINTED PERISHABLE, RUSH, INSULATED, WITH ORIENTATION UP ARROWS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZC651X50118415253, 1ZC651X50102585037, 1ZC651X5PW14170647, 1ZC651X50120998094 AND 1ZC651X50120240106. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM VIRGINIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER C651X5, SPUDZ FRIES, 1369 NEW YORK AVE NE, WASHINGTON DC 20002-1620.

item.title: Report X-2024031279
item.description:
Report X-2024031279

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IN THE UNLOAD, THE HAZMAT WAS DAMAGED DUE TO IMPROPER HANDLING. THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRAILER AND SLAMMED ON THE ROLLERS CAUSING THE HAZMAT BOTTLES TO UNSCREW AND SPILL ALL OVER THE FLOOR DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION ONE OF THE BOTTLES WERE LOOSE CAUSING THE SPILL TO RIP THE BOX OPEN DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED HAZMAT WAS PLACED INSIDE IN A SAFTEY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING WET.

item.title: Report X-2024031250
item.description:
Report X-2024031250

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded off of a trailer damaged. When the package was discovered, the package was given to a manager and placed in the hazmat cage under vent hood. DescribePack: Plastic drum is cracked along the bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was given to a manager by a package handler, manager then places package in Haz mat bin, and the Haz mat was then placed under hood vent and the vent was turned on.

item.title: Report E-2024030518
item.description:
Report E-2024030518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: SANDSTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Starlite Built Liquid Alkali was released from (1) 55-gallon DF due to the cap coming off of the drum. The release impacted the top of the drum only. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Hepaco arrived on site and neutralized the impacted area on top of the impacted drum. Once cleaned and neutralized, Hepaco replaced the damaged cap with a new one and ensured it was on tight. All 4 drums were then resecured and shrink-wrapped. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing impacted absorbent pads and PPE.
